mods.abstract: Female adult, wax shoulder head, cloth body with composition arms and lower limbs, glass eyes, blonde wig, jointed at shoulders, hips, and knees, flat sole navy blue shoes with brown knitted stockings, shoes have buckles and buttons, white underwear with lace trimming, three underskirts, including one with wool, full length separated red wool dress, side-skirt has pressed pleats, under-skirt with another fabric, front panel has three horizontal pleats on top of the skirt, flower embroidered lower front, same color velvet stripes next to the front panel, pointed waist, velvet decoration on front bodice and sleeves, ribbon on shoulders and front and back, lace trimmed, collar and edge of sleeves, velvet bonnet with ribbon decoration. The doll was given to Miss M. Blake by Queen Victoria of England. Accompanying information describes that Miss Blake was the daughter of the caretaker of the Osborn house from 1890-95. As a child, Miss Blake attended the Royal Family Christmas parties and received many delightful gifts. 'My Victoria' was the choicest gift of all. Kimport obtained this doll through our agent in London direct from Miss Blake in 1957. Doll body is machine-made. Dress is hand-made.""
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
